hpnicfEponUni.name: hpnicfEponUni
hpnicfEponUni.description: The objects in this MIB module are used to manage and display current configuration of UNI (user network interface) which is based on the ONU(Optical Network Unit).

hpnicfEponUniSysManTable.name: hpnicfEponUniSysManTable
hpnicfEponUniSysManTable.description: This table defines several UNI system parameters.

hpnicfEponUniIndex.name: hpnicfEponUniIndex
hpnicfEponUniIndex.description: The index value which uniquely identifies the FE(fast Ethernet) interface of the ONU.

hpnicfEponUniDescr.name: hpnicfEponUniDescr
hpnicfEponUniDescr.description: A textual string containing information about the interface. This string should include the name of the manufacturer, the product name and the version of the interface hardware and software.

hpnicfEponUniAdminStatus.name: hpnicfEponUniAdminStatus
hpnicfEponUniAdminStatus.description: The desired state of the user network interface. When a managed system initializes, all user network interfaces start with down(2) state. The testing(3)state indicates that no operational packets can be passed. As a result of either explicit management action or per configuration information retained by the managed system, hpnicfEponUniAdminStatus is then changed to either the up(1) or testing(3) states (or remains in the down(2) state).

hpnicfEponUniMdi.name: hpnicfEponUniMdi
hpnicfEponUniMdi.description: Type of the line connected to UNI interface: mdi-ii(straight-through cable), mdi-x (crossover cable), mdi-auto (auto-sensing).

hpnicfEponUniPriority.name: hpnicfEponUniPriority
hpnicfEponUniPriority.description: The priority of user network interface. If the value is larger, the priority will be higher.

hpnicfEponUniAccessVlan.name: hpnicfEponUniAccessVlan
hpnicfEponUniAccessVlan.description: The vlan ID assigned to untagged frames or Priority-Tagged frames received on user network interface.

hpnicfEponUniTrunkPvid.name: hpnicfEponUniTrunkPvid
hpnicfEponUniTrunkPvid.description: PVID(port vlan ID), the vlan ID assigned to untagged frames or Priority-Tagged frames received on user network interface.

hpnicfEponUniVLANTrunkAllowListLow.name: hpnicfEponUniVLANTrunkAllowListLow
hpnicfEponUniVLANTrunkAllowListLow.description: Each octet within this value specifies a set of eight vlans, with the first octet specifying vlans 1 through 8, the second octet specifying vlans 9 through 16, etc. Within each octet, the most significant bit represents the highest numbered VLAN, and the least significant bit represents the lowest numbered VLAN. Thus, each allowed vlan of the trunk port is represented by a single bit within the value of this object. If that bit has a value of '1' then that vlan is allowed in the set of vlans. the vlan is not allowed if its bit has a value of '0'.

hpnicfEponUniVLANTrunkAllowListHigh.name: hpnicfEponUniVLANTrunkAllowListHigh
hpnicfEponUniVLANTrunkAllowListHigh.description: Each octet within this value specifies a set of eight vlans, with the first octet specifying vlans 2049 through 2056, the second octet specifying vlans 2057 through 2064, etc. Within each octet, the most significant bit represents the highest numbered vlan, and the least significant bit represents the lowest numbered vlan. Thus, each allowed vlan of the trunk port is represented by a single bit within the value of this object. If that bit has a value of '1' then that vlan is allowed in the set of vlans; the vlan is not allowed if its bit has a value of '0'.

hpnicfEponUniInboundLineRate.name: hpnicfEponUniInboundLineRate
hpnicfEponUniInboundLineRate.description: The value of the inbound line-rate. measured with kbps. The upper limit of the line-rate is the value of hpnicfEponUniLineRateMax in the entry. It must be multiple of the value of hpnicfEponUniLineRateStep. The default value of hpnicfEponUniLineRate is the value of hpnicfEponUniLineRateMax.

hpnicfEponUniOutboundLineRate.name: hpnicfEponUniOutboundLineRate
hpnicfEponUniOutboundLineRate.description: The value of the outbound line-rate. measured with kbps. The upper limit of the line-rate is the value of hpnicfEponUniLineRateMax in the entry. It must be multiple of the value of hpnicfEponUniLineRateStep. The default value of hpnicfEponUniLineRate is the value of hpnicfEponUniLineRateMax.

hpnicfEponUniFlowControl.name: hpnicfEponUniFlowControl
hpnicfEponUniFlowControl.description: Flow control status. true(1) - Flow control status enable. false(2) - Flow control status disable.

hpnicfEponUniVlanVPNStatus.name: hpnicfEponUniVlanVPNStatus
hpnicfEponUniVlanVPNStatus.description: vlan VPN status. true(1) - vlan VPN status enable. false(2) - vlan VPN disable.

hpnicfEponUniCountReset.name: hpnicfEponUniCountReset
hpnicfEponUniCountReset.description: Reset the counter which is about packets of the interface, then the counter will change to zero. There is no sense in reading this object.

hpnicfEponUniPortIsolate.name: hpnicfEponUniPortIsolate
hpnicfEponUniPortIsolate.description: enable - enable UNI port isolate setting. disable - disable UNI port isolate setting.

hpnicfEponUniVlanConfiguration.name: hpnicfEponUniVlanConfiguration
hpnicfEponUniVlanConfiguration.description: The vlan configuration of the related vlan mode. Transparent vlan mode: hpnicfEponUniVlanConfiguration is a zero length string. Tag vlan mode: the first four octets were the tag assigned to untagged frames received on UNI, including TPID, VID,CFI and priority. Translation vlan mode: the first four octets were the old tag (including TPID, VID, CFI and priority), which is replaced by the new tag(including TPID, VID, CFI and priority), the second four octets.

hpnicfEponUniAutoNegotiation.name: hpnicfEponUniAutoNegotiation
hpnicfEponUniAutoNegotiation.description: enable - enable auto negotiation. disable - disable auto negotiation.

hpnicfEponUniRestartAutoNeg.name: hpnicfEponUniRestartAutoNeg
hpnicfEponUniRestartAutoNeg.description: Force to restart the auto negotiation process.

hpnicfEponUniVitualCableTest.name: hpnicfEponUniVitualCableTest
hpnicfEponUniVitualCableTest.description: True(1): Virtual cable test enable. False(2): Virtual cable test disable.

hpnicfEponUniVCTCableStatus.name: hpnicfEponUniVCTCableStatus
hpnicfEponUniVCTCableStatus.description: Get the cable status. Normal(1),cable is normal. Abnormal(2),cable is abnormal. AbnormalOpen(3),cable is abnormal because of open circuit. AbnormalShort(4),cable is abnormal because of short circuit. Failure(5),cable is abnormal because of testing failure.

hpnicfEponUniVCTCableLength.name: hpnicfEponUniVCTCableLength
hpnicfEponUniVCTCableLength.description: Get the cable length. When hpnicfEponUniVCTCableStatus is normal, the node stands for the length from the UNI port to the port opposite. When hpnicfEponUniVCTCableStatus is abnormal, it stands for the lengh from the UNI port to the failure place. Unit:meter(m).

hpnicfEponUniVCTImpedanceMismatch.name: hpnicfEponUniVCTImpedanceMismatch
hpnicfEponUniVCTImpedanceMismatch.description: Get the cable impedance. Not-support(1),the UNI port does not support this function. True(2),impedance match. False(3),impedance mismatch.

hpnicfEponUniVCTPairSkew.name: hpnicfEponUniVCTPairSkew
hpnicfEponUniVCTPairSkew.description: Get the symmetry of cable. If the function is not supported, the default value 0 will be returned. Unit:nanosecond(ns).

hpnicfEponUniVCTPairSwap.name: hpnicfEponUniVCTPairSwap
hpnicfEponUniVCTPairSwap.description: NotSupport(1),the UNI port does not support this function. True(2),pair swap. False(3),not pair swap.

hpnicfEponUniVCTPolaritySwap.name: hpnicfEponUniVCTPolaritySwap
hpnicfEponUniVCTPolaritySwap.description: NotSupport(1),the UNI port does not support this function. True(2),polarity swap. False(3),not polarity swap.

hpnicfEponUniVCTInsertionLoss.name: hpnicfEponUniVCTInsertionLoss
hpnicfEponUniVCTInsertionLoss.description: If the function is not supported, the default value 0 will be returned. Unit:decibel(db).

hpnicfEponUniVCTReturnLoss.name: hpnicfEponUniVCTReturnLoss
hpnicfEponUniVCTReturnLoss.description: If the function is not supported, the default value 0 will be returned. Unit:decibel(db).

hpnicfEponUniVCTNearendCrosstalk.name: hpnicfEponUniVCTNearendCrosstalk
hpnicfEponUniVCTNearendCrosstalk.description: If the function is not supported, the default value 0 will be returned. Unit:decibel(db).

hpnicfEponUniVlan.name: hpnicfEponUniVlan
hpnicfEponUniVlan.description: If the function is not supported, the default value 0 will be returned. Unit:decibel(db).

hpnicfEponUniCountTable.name: hpnicfEponUniCountTable
hpnicfEponUniCountTable.description: A list of interface counter about frames entries.

hpnicfEponUniCountEntry.name: hpnicfEponUniCountEntry
hpnicfEponUniCountEntry.description: An entry containing management information applicable to a particular interface.

hpnicfEponUniInStatsPkts.name: hpnicfEponUniInStatsPkts
hpnicfEponUniInStatsPkts.description: The total number of frames (including bad frames, broadcast frames, and multicast frames) received.

hpnicfEponUniInStatsUnicastPkts.name: hpnicfEponUniInStatsUnicastPkts
hpnicfEponUniInStatsUnicastPkts.description: The total number of good frames received that are directed to the unicast address. Note that this does not include multicast and broadcast frames.

hpnicfEponUniInStatsBroadcastPkts.name: hpnicfEponUniInStatsBroadcastPkts
hpnicfEponUniInStatsBroadcastPkts.description: The total number of good frames received that are directed to the broadcast address. Note that this does not include multicast frames.

hpnicfEponUniInStatsMulticastPkts.name: hpnicfEponUniInStatsMulticastPkts
hpnicfEponUniInStatsMulticastPkts.description: The total number of good frames received that are directed to a multicast address. Note that this number does not include frames directed to the broadcast address.

hpnicfEponUniInPausePkts.name: hpnicfEponUniInPausePkts
hpnicfEponUniInPausePkts.description: A count of MAC Control frames received on this interface by the pause(flow control) operation. This counter does not increment when the interface is in a half-duplex mode. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system.

hpnicfEponUniInTotalErrors.name: hpnicfEponUniInTotalErrors
hpnicfEponUniInTotalErrors.description: Total count of the error frames received on this interface.

hpnicfEponUniInStatsCRCAlignErrors.name: hpnicfEponUniInStatsCRCAlignErrors
hpnicfEponUniInStatsCRCAlignErrors.description: The total number of frames received that had a length (excluding framing bits, but including FCS octets) of between 64 and 1518 octets, inclusive, but had either a bad Frame Check Sequence (FCS) with an integral number of octets (FCS Error) or a bad FCS with a non-integral number of octets (Alignment Error).

hpnicfEponUniInStatsUndersizePkts.name: hpnicfEponUniInStatsUndersizePkts
hpnicfEponUniInStatsUndersizePkts.description: The total number of frames received that are less than 64 octets long (excluding framing bits, but including FCS octets) and are otherwise well formed.

hpnicfEponUniInStatsOversizePkts.name: hpnicfEponUniInStatsOversizePkts
hpnicfEponUniInStatsOversizePkts.description: The total number of frames received that are longer than 1518 octets (excluding framing bits, but including FCS octets) and are otherwise well formed.

hpnicfEponUniInErrorbyOther.name: hpnicfEponUniInErrorbyOther
hpnicfEponUniInErrorbyOther.description: The total number of error frames received on this interface.

hpnicfEponUniOutStatsPkts.name: hpnicfEponUniOutStatsPkts
hpnicfEponUniOutStatsPkts.description: The total number of frames (including bad frames, broadcast frames, and multicast frames) sent.

hpnicfEponUniOutStatsUnicastPkts.name: hpnicfEponUniOutStatsUnicastPkts
hpnicfEponUniOutStatsUnicastPkts.description: The total number of good frames sent that are directed to the unicast address. Note that this does not include multicast and broadcast frames.

hpnicfEponUniOutStatsBroadcastPkts.name: hpnicfEponUniOutStatsBroadcastPkts
hpnicfEponUniOutStatsBroadcastPkts.description: The total number of good frames sent that are directed to the broadcast address. Note that this does not include multicast frames.

hpnicfEponUniOutStatsMulticastPkts.name: hpnicfEponUniOutStatsMulticastPkts
hpnicfEponUniOutStatsMulticastPkts.description: The total number of good frames sent that are directed to a multicast address. Note that this number does not include frames directed to the broadcast address.

hpnicfEponUniOutStatsPausePkts.name: hpnicfEponUniOutStatsPausePkts
hpnicfEponUniOutStatsPausePkts.description: The total number of MAC control frames sent on this interface by the pause operation. This counter does not increment when the interface is in a half-duplex mode. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system.

hpnicfEponUniOutTotalErrors.name: hpnicfEponUniOutTotalErrors
hpnicfEponUniOutTotalErrors.description: The total number of error frames sent on this interface.

hpnicfEponUniOutStatsCollisions.name: hpnicfEponUniOutStatsCollisions
hpnicfEponUniOutStatsCollisions.description: The best estimate of the total number of collisions on this Ethernet segment. The value returned will depend on the location of the RMON probe. Section 8.2.1.3 (10BASE-5) and section 10.3.1.3 (10BASE-2) of IEEE standard 802.3 states that a station must detect a collision, in the receive mode, if three or more stations are transmitting simultaneously. A repeater port must detect a collision when two or more stations are transmitting simultaneously. Thus a probe placed on a repeater port could record more collisions than a probe connected to a station on the same segment could. Probe location plays a much smaller role when considering 10BASE-T. 14.2.1.4 (10BASE-T) of IEEE standard 802.3 defines a collision as the simultaneous presence of signals on the DO and RD circuits (transmitting and receiving at the same time). A 10BASE-T station can only detect collisions when it is transmitting. Thus probes placed on a station and a repeater, should report the same number of collisions. Note also that an RMON probe inside a repeater should ideally report collisions between the repeater and one or more other hosts (transmit collisions as defined by IEEE 802.3k) plus receiver collisions observed on any coax segments to which the repeater is connected.

hpnicfEponUniOutDelayExceededDiscards.name: hpnicfEponUniOutDelayExceededDiscards
hpnicfEponUniOutDelayExceededDiscards.description: The number of frames discarded by this port due to excessive transit delay through the bridge. It is incremented by both transparent and source route bridges.

hpnicfEponUniOutErrorbyOther.name: hpnicfEponUniOutErrorbyOther
hpnicfEponUniOutErrorbyOther.description: The total number of other error frames sent on this interface. Other error frames means the error frames out of collision frames and excessive delayed frames.

hpnicfEponUniOutDroppedFrames.name: hpnicfEponUniOutDroppedFrames
hpnicfEponUniOutDroppedFrames.description: The total number of frames dropped because of buffer failure.

hpnicfEponUniIgmpInfoTable.name: hpnicfEponUniIgmpInfoTable
hpnicfEponUniIgmpInfoTable.description: This table stores igmp information of UNI interface.

hpnicfEponUniMacIndex.name: hpnicfEponUniMacIndex
hpnicfEponUniMacIndex.description: The index uniquely identifies the igmp information in current UNI interface.

hpnicfEponUniIgmpMacAddress.name: hpnicfEponUniIgmpMacAddress
hpnicfEponUniIgmpMacAddress.description: A 6-octet read-only value carrying the individual MAC address indicates which igmp group the UNI interface belonging to.

hpnicfEponUniIgmpVlanId.name: hpnicfEponUniIgmpVlanId
hpnicfEponUniIgmpVlanId.description: An integer range from 1 to 4094 indicates the vlan which the igmp Mac address has joined in.

hpnicfEponUniLineRateMax.name: hpnicfEponUniLineRateMax
hpnicfEponUniLineRateMax.description: The maximum value of the line-rate(kbps) that user network interface can be set.

hpnicfEponUniNumberOnOnu.name: hpnicfEponUniNumberOnOnu
hpnicfEponUniNumberOnOnu.description: The user network interface number on ONU.

hpnicfEponUniPortPolicyStatus.name: hpnicfEponUniPortPolicyStatus
hpnicfEponUniPortPolicyStatus.description: enable - enable UNI upstream port policing. disable - disable UNI upstream port policing.

hpnicfEponUniPortPolicyCir.name: hpnicfEponUniPortPolicyCir
hpnicfEponUniPortPolicyCir.description: The committed information rate, ranging from 1 to 102400, measured in kbps.

hpnicfEponUniPortPolicyBucketDepth.name: hpnicfEponUniPortPolicyBucketDepth
hpnicfEponUniPortPolicyBucketDepth.description: The depth of the token bucket to tolerant the certain burst(CBS), ranging from 0 to 65535, measured in bytes.

hpnicfEponUniPortPolicyExtraBurst.name: hpnicfEponUniPortPolicyExtraBurst
hpnicfEponUniPortPolicyExtraBurst.description: The extra token to permit the forwarding engine to finish the packet being sent when the bucket depth is exhausted, ranging from 0 to 65535, measured in bytes.

hpnicfEponUniPortPolicyInboundCir.name: hpnicfEponUniPortPolicyInboundCir
hpnicfEponUniPortPolicyInboundCir.description: The inbound committed information rate, measured in kbps.

hpnicfEponUniPortPolicyInboundBucketDept.name: hpnicfEponUniPortPolicyInboundBucketDepth
hpnicfEponUniPortPolicyInboundBucketDept.description: The inbound depth of the token bucket to tolerant the certain burst(CBS), ranging from 0 to 65535, measured in bytes.

hpnicfEponUniPortPolicyInboundExtraBurst.name: hpnicfEponUniPortPolicyInboundExtraBurst
hpnicfEponUniPortPolicyInboundExtraBurst.description: The inbound extra token to permit the forwarding engine to finish the packet being sent when the bucket depth is exhausted, ranging from 0 to 65535, measured in bytes.

hpnicfEponUniPortPolicyOutboundCir.name: hpnicfEponUniPortPolicyOutboundCir
hpnicfEponUniPortPolicyOutboundCir.description: The outbound committed information rate, stepped by 64, measured in kbps.

hpnicfEponUniPortPolicyOutboundPir.name: hpnicfEponUniPortPolicyOutboundPir
hpnicfEponUniPortPolicyOutboundPir.description: The outbound peak information rate, stepped by 64, measured in kbps.

hpnicfEponUniMulticastGroupNumber.name: hpnicfEponUniMulticastGroupNumber
hpnicfEponUniMulticastGroupNumber.description: The allowed multicast group number that can be handled at the same time by UNI.

hpnicfEponUniMulticastVlanList.name: hpnicfEponUniMulticastVlanList
hpnicfEponUniMulticastVlanList.description: The multicast vlan list. The first two octets of the string represent the first VLAN ID; the second two octets of the string represent the second VLAN ID, and so on. It is a zero length string by default.

hpnicfEponUniMulticastStripStatus.name: hpnicfEponUniMulticastStripStatus
hpnicfEponUniMulticastStripStatus.description: true - strip the vlan tag of multicast packet. false - does not strip the vlan tag of multicast packet.

hpnicfEponUniMulticastFastleave.name: hpnicfEponUniMulticastFastleave
hpnicfEponUniMulticastFastleave.description: true(1) - fast leave of IGMP enable on ONU. false(2) - fast leave of IGMP disable on ONU.

hpnicfEponUniLocalTechAbility.name: hpnicfEponUniLocalTechAbility
hpnicfEponUniLocalTechAbility.description: The local port capabilities of the UNI. Each two octets stand for a capability of UNI: the first two octets represent one capability and the second two octets represent another capability, and so on. The capabilities list: 1 - undefined, 2 - initializing, true ability not yet known, 14 - 10BASE-T, 142 - full duplex 10BASE-T, 23 - 100BASE-T4, 25 - 100BASE-TX, 252 - full duplex 100BASE-TX, 312 - PAUSE operation for full duplex links, 313 - asymmetric PAUSE operation for full duplex links, 314 - symmetric PAUSE operation for full duplex links, 32 - 100BASE-T2, 322 - full duplex 100BASE-T2, 36 - 1000BASE-X, 362 - full duplex 1000BASE-X, 40 - 1000BASE-T UTP PHY, 402 - full duplex 1000BASE-T UTP PHY, 37 - remote fault bit 1(RF1), 372 - remote fault bit 2(RF2), 8029 - 802.9ISLAN-16T.

hpnicfEponUniAdvertisedTechAbility.name: hpnicfEponUniAdvertisedTechAbility
hpnicfEponUniAdvertisedTechAbility.description: The advertised port capabilities of the UNI. The capabilities list references the description of hpnicfEponUniLocalTechAbility.

hpnicfEponUniMulticastControlEntry.name: hpnicfEponUniMulticastControlEntry
hpnicfEponUniMulticastControlEntry.description: The entry of the table hpnicfEponUniMulticastControlTable.

hpnicfEponUniMulticastAddressList.name: hpnicfEponUniMulticastAddressList
hpnicfEponUniMulticastAddressList.description: The multicast address, each four octets represents a multicast address, the address section ranging from the first four octets to the second four octets, and the like.

hpnicfEponUniMulticastAccessRule.name: hpnicfEponUniMulticastAccessRule
hpnicfEponUniMulticastAccessRule.description: deny - deny the multicast packet. permit - permit the multicast packet. preview - permit the multicast packet with conditions.

hpnicfEponUniMulticastChannelLimit.name: hpnicfEponUniMulticastChannelLimit
hpnicfEponUniMulticastChannelLimit.description: The limitation of multicast preview channel number.

hpnicfEponUniMulticastPreTimeSlice.name: hpnicfEponUniMulticastPreTimeSlice
hpnicfEponUniMulticastPreTimeSlice.description: The time slice of multicast preview.

hpnicfEponUniMulticastPreTimes.name: hpnicfEponUniMulticastPreTimes
hpnicfEponUniMulticastPreTimes.description: The number of multicast preview times.

hpnicfEponUniMulticastPreInterval.name: hpnicfEponUniMulticastPreInterval
hpnicfEponUniMulticastPreInterval.description: The interval between two consecutive previews, measured in minute.

hpnicfEponUniMulticastRowStatus.name: hpnicfEponUniMulticastRowStatus
hpnicfEponUniMulticastRowStatus.description: The status of this table entry. The active, createAndGo and the destory statuses are supported.

hpnicfEponUniMulticastSourceIpList.name: hpnicfEponUniMulticastSourceIpList
hpnicfEponUniMulticastSourceIpList.description: This list contains many source ip addresses. Each ip address is contained in four octets.

hpnicfEponUniMulticastResetInterval.name: hpnicfEponUniMulticastResetInterval
hpnicfEponUniMulticastResetInterval.description: The interval is measured in minute. From the last preview limitation is reached, a customer can preview again after this interval is expired.

hpnicfEponUniQosIndexNextEntry.name: hpnicfEponUniQosIndexNextEntry
hpnicfEponUniQosIndexNextEntry.description: The entry of the table hpnicfEponUniQosIndexNextTable.

hpnicfEponUniQosConfIndexNext.name: hpnicfEponUniQosConfIndexNext
hpnicfEponUniQosConfIndexNext.description: This object contains an appropriate value to be used for hpnicfEponUniQosConfIndex when creating rows in the hpnicfEponUniQosConfTable.

hpnicfEponUniQosConfEntry.name: hpnicfEponUniQosConfEntry
hpnicfEponUniQosConfEntry.description: The entry of the table hpnicfEponUniQosConfTable.

hpnicfEponUniQosConfRuleIndexNext.name: hpnicfEponUniQosConfRuleIndexNext
hpnicfEponUniQosConfRuleIndexNext.description: This object contains an appropriate value to be used for hpnicfEponUniQosRuleIndex when creating rows in the hpnicfEponUniQosRuleTable.

hpnicfEponUniQosConfMappedQueue.name: hpnicfEponUniQosConfMappedQueue
hpnicfEponUniQosConfMappedQueue.description: The queue that the ethernet frames will be mapped.

hpnicfEponUniQosConfMarkedPriority.name: hpnicfEponUniQosConfMarkedPriority
hpnicfEponUniQosConfMarkedPriority.description: Priority of the ethernet frames to be marked, which compliant with the 802.1D user priority standard.

hpnicfEponUniQosConfRowStatus.name: hpnicfEponUniQosConfRowStatus
hpnicfEponUniQosConfRowStatus.description: The status of this table entry. The active, createAndGo and the destory statuses are supported.

hpnicfEponUniQosRuleTable.name: hpnicfEponUniQosRuleTable
hpnicfEponUniQosRuleTable.description: Qos sub rule of the UNI.

hpnicfEponUniQosRuleEntry.name: hpnicfEponUniQosRuleEntry
hpnicfEponUniQosRuleEntry.description: The entry of the table hpnicfEponUniQosRuleTable.

hpnicfEponUniQosRuleSelector.name: hpnicfEponUniQosRuleSelector
hpnicfEponUniQosRuleSelector.description: The ethernet frame selector. dstmac - based on destination MAC address. srcmac - based on source MAC address. ethernetpriority - based on ethernet priority. vlanid - based on VLAN ID. ethernettype - based on ethernet type. dstip - based on destination IP address. srcip - based on source IP address. ipprototype - based on IP type(ipv4 or ipv6). ipv4tosdscp - based on IP TOS/DSCP. ipv6 - based IP precedence. srcport - based on layer 4 source port. dstport - based on layer 4 destination port.

hpnicfEponUniQosRuleValue.name: hpnicfEponUniQosRuleValue
hpnicfEponUniQosRuleValue.description: The rule value based on the hpnicfEponUniQosRuleSelector.

hpnicfEponUniQosRuleOperator.name: hpnicfEponUniQosRuleOperator
hpnicfEponUniQosRuleOperator.description: nervermatch - value never match. equal - field equal to the value. notequal - field not equal to the value. lessthanequal - field less than or equal to the value. greaterthanequal - field greater than or equal to the value. fieldexist - value is ignored if field exists. fieldnotexist - value is ignored if field does not exist. alwaysmatch - value always match.

hpnicfEponUniQosRuleRowStatus.name: hpnicfEponUniQosRuleRowStatus
hpnicfEponUniQosRuleRowStatus.description: The status of this table entry. Only active, createAndGo and the destory are supported.

hpnicfEponUniMirrorGroupTable.name: hpnicfEponUniMirrorGroupTable
hpnicfEponUniMirrorGroupTable.description: Qos sub rule of the UNI.

hpnicfEponUniMirrorInboundPortList.name: hpnicfEponUniMirrorInboundPortList
hpnicfEponUniMirrorInboundPortList.description: UNI inbound port list. Each octet within this value specifies a set of eight ports, with the first octet specifying ports 1 through 8, the second octet specifying ports 9 through 16, etc. Within each octet, the most significant bit represents the highest numbered UNI, and the least significant bit represents the lowest numbered UNI. Thus, each UNI port is represented by a single bit within the value of this object. If that bit has a value of '1' then that port is allowed in the set of ports. the port is not allowed if its bit has a value of '0'.

hpnicfEponUniMirrorOutboundPortList.description: UNI outnbound port list, more infomation reference hpnicfEponUniMirrorInboundPortList
